doc.after: For much of the 20th century the Conservative party took a broadly Atlanticist stance in relations with the United States favouring close ties with the United States and similarly aligned nations such as Canada Australia and Japan The Conservatives have generally favoured a diverse range of international alliances ranging from the North Atlantic Treaty Organization NATO to the Commonwealth of Nations
